oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Dick Curless Interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Dick Curless (performer) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Dick Curless; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Richard William Curless and Biff Collie speak about his birth and snowmobiles -- (00:59) Collie and Curless talk about being catholic with his birthday on St. Patrick's Day -- (1:40) Curless talks about his brother Phillip and his parents professions -- (03:06) Collie asks about Curless' first memory and Curless recalls his first song "When Dad was Around" -- (03:51) Curless talks about traveling across Canada with Buck Owens when the World Series was being played -- (05:59) Curless recalls when the recording of "When Dad was Around" occurred -- (06:27) Collie and Curless discuss Curless' relationship with music through his family -- (07:52) Collie asks about Canadian influences -- (07:58) Curless speaks on the presumptions about him based on where he grew up -- (08:42) Curless and Collie talk about the depression era and Canadian influences on musical tastes -- (10:10) Curless talks about moving to Massachusetts and rebuilding their lives -- (10:56) Curless talks about the war effort -- (11:09) Collie inquires about the family musical tastes and Curless talks on the rarity of funds for music -- (12:16) Curless speaks on learning to play the bones -- (12:49) Curless reflects on moving to Massachusetts and his initial school memories and playing the tuba -- (14:25) Collie and Curless talk about Curless' musical performances; Curless included his minstrel shows -- (16:50) Collie and Curless talk about his role in plays and having his friends support -- (18:04) Collie talks about his father's ritual with pig's feet and Curless reflects on Jimmy Rogers among other records his father would acquire -- (20:18) Collie tells a story about Rose Maddox listening outside of saloons; Curless talks about his kickoff -- (21:48) Curless talks about meeting Yodelin' Slim Clark and working for him -- (22:31) Curless talks about skipping school to learn from with Clark at a radio station -- (24:10) Curless talks about listening to himself as Dick the Tumbleweed Kid on Clark's show -- (24:38) Curless talks about being a senior in high school and determining whether or not he would graduate -- (26:11) Curless discusses going to Greenfield with Clark to prepare for Clark's upcoming tour -- (27:24) Curless talks about his first sponsor and his first personal appearance -- (28:28) Collie and Curless discuss the post-tour time; Curless had to work labor jobs -- (29:10) Curless talks about Trailriders counter parts and moving to Maine -- (30:32) Collie and Curless talk about: the Coast of Maine, Curless' first record -- (31:31) Collie asks Curless' next step; and, Curless began to speak about being drafted and life around that time -- (33:01) Curless talks about his basic training and going to Korea -- (33:50) Curless talks about his interview to be a disc jockey for the armed forces -- (34:36) Curless talks about being part of the Armed Forces Radio Service; his new job saved him from dangerous work -- (36:41) Curless talks about the success and expanding role in the eastern Asian radio -- (38:39) Collie and Curless joke and talk about Curless seeing California for the first time -- (39:50) Curless reflects on his inability to settle into society and post traumatic stress disorder -- (41:42) Curless addresses veterans and caring a knife on him, at all times, for years -- (42:49) Collie and Curless discuss his record career and entering a talent competition -- (44:30) Curless talks about tryouts for the Arthur Godfrey Show and meeting a transcendent talent; Curless advised him to lie -- (47:06) Curless talked about touring New York after winning the talent competition and playing a song with an orchestral backing -- (50:45) Curless talked about being talked to by multiple members of the Arthur Godfrey to avoid confrontation -- (52:08) Curless discusses him discovery of his own styling -- (53:13) Curless discusses Godfrey's ability to sell a product -- (53:48) Collie and Curless touch on the Arthur Godfrey Show's affect on his career
